fileheader.note:
This model was created using publicly available data, publicly available technical reports, textbooks, and guesses. It contains no proprietary or restricted data. It has been validated only to the extent that it seems to "fly right", and possibly to comply to published, publicly known, performance data (maximum speed, endurance, etc.). Thus, this model is meant for educational and entertainment purposes only.
This simulation model is not endorsed by the manufacturer. This model is not to be sold.
extended range fuel 54,388 US gal (364,400 lb).
center of gravity between 13.0 % and 33.0 % of MAC.
gear height adjusted by 3D model, supposed accurate.
fileheader.limitation: at landing the arm of CG must be weak, otherwise pitch control is too slow to react at touch-down.
fileheader.documentation:
MAC : 327.8 in. Datum : - balance arm datum corresponds to body station 0, at 90 in. forward of nose. - horizontal distance of datum to nose gear jack points in 384.7 in. Leading edge of MAC : 1258 in.
MAC starts at 1168 in. from nose, and continues above the gears.
Dimensions : lateral position of engines. gear tracks. Gear stearing. Tanks typical quantities.

- http://www.aoe.vt.edu/~mason/Mason_f/M96SC02.pdf/ (Willian H. Mason) :
CG range : 13.0 / 33.0 % MAC.
- http://www.bh.com/companions/034074152X/appendices/data-a/table-3/table.htm :
Horizontal tail : area 136.60 m2, arm 32.50 m, 1/4 chord sweep 32.00 m. Vertical tail : area 77.10 m2, arm 30.00 m, 1/4 chord sweep 45.00 m. V2 177 kt, Vapp 141 kt, Vne/Mme 445 kt / 0.95 Mach.
- http://www.airliners.net/discussions/tech_ops/read.main/52218/6/#ID52218 :
V2 190 kt (max takeoff load), climbs without flaps only at V2 + 100 kt. VREF 154 kt (max landing load).

reference.author: Robert K. Heffley and Wayne F. Jewell
reference.title: Aircraft handling qualities data

fileheader.documentation:
- http://ntrs.nasa.gov/ :
747 coefficients : - mach 0.20 is the landing configuration (flaps 30). - mach 0.25 is the approach configuration (flaps 20).
Estimation of drag and lift at zero lift : - CDo = CD - ( CDalpha x alpha + CDmach x mach + CDflaps + CDLE + CDgear ). - CLo = CL - ( CLalpha x alpha + CLmach x mach + CLflaps + CLLE + CLde x ds ). - table IX-3 provides alpha and mach. - stabilizer, drag and lift are guessed from drawings. - CDde, which is not included in CDo formula, adjusts range.

metrics.documentation: - aero reference point is at empty load CG (33 % MAC) : less arm for landing; control is supposed easier if CG is forwards. - VRP at nose. - gear estimated at 25 ft (300 in.) below nose. - wing incidence helps the takeoff.

mass_balance.documentation: - operational empty weight = 376170 lb + 160 lb for extended fuel range. - empty CG at 23 % MAC (no payload). - the point mass is the equivalent payload to get 833000 lb; adjusted so that CG at empty fuel is 33 % MAC (1276 in.), full load 20 % (1232 in.).

ground_reactions.documentation: - gear height determined by 3D model, supposed at scale. - additonal contact points for crash detection, when gear retracted.

propulsion.documentation: - tank arm and lateral position is a guess : must fit inside the wing, in front of gear well; and close of aero reference point to minimize the CG shift. - typical quantities (52340 US gal). - extended range fuel (2048 US gal), spread on the reserve tanks. - 1 US gal = 6.7 lb. - reference length is 229 ft 2 in (includes elevator). - reference width is 195 ft 8 in (wing span)

tank.documentation: - center wing : 17160 US gal, 39/100 length (wing); - as the tanks are emptying, CG shifts aft.
main 1 and 4 : 4490 US gal, 48/100 length, 21/84 width.
main 2 and 3 : 12570 US gal, 43/100 length, 10/84 width.
reserve 1 and 4 : 530 + 1024 US gal, 45/100 length, 16/84 width.

axis.name: DRAG
axis.documentation: - replaced by CR D-2144 + CDAlpha : see formula above.
- added from CR D-2144. - drag is always positiv.
- replaced by CR D-2144. - divide by 10, to cruise at Mach 0.84.
- drag always positive. - 0.0550 -> 0.0055 : divide by 10, to enable climb. - adjust range by increasing drag of CR D-2144.

axis.name: LIFT
axis.documentation: - add Mach 0.2 to aeromatic : without flaps, 290 kt to climb at full load. - replaced by CR D-2144 : see formula above.

aeromatic was 1.5 : - reduces landing flaps lift, to respect VREF 154 kt : obliged to reduce the lift at 30 deg. - keeps takeoff flaps lift, to respect V2 190 kt. - includes the flaps inside the ground effect, to get more lift.
replaced by CR D-2144.
- added from CR D-2144 : only data at sea level.
- added from CR D-2144 : only data at sea level.

axis.name: ROLL
axis.documentation: - 0.1000 (left-aileron-pos-rad) replaced by CR D-2144. - differential-inboard-aileron-rad multiplies by 2 left-aileron-pos-rad.
